MoPlot 0.0.0.9000

Plot One-Way Linear Model Highlighting Contrasts

Source: R/MoPlotOneWay.R
MoPlotOneWay.Rd

Visualizes a one-way linear model with a single categorical predictor and numeric dependent variable. Supports multiple contrast types including treatment, sum, successive differences (sdif), Helmert, reverse Helmert, polynomial and customized contrasts.

Usage

MoPlotOneWay(
  LinearMod,
  data = FALSE,
  siglevel = 0.05,
  coef = FALSE,
  facet.pers = TRUE
)

Arguments

LinearMod

A fitted linear model object (from lm()) with one numeric response and one categorical predictor.

data

Logical. If TRUE, overlays individual data points on the plot (default: FALSE).

siglevel

Numeric. Significance level for testing contrasts and confidence intervals (default: 0.05).

coef

Logical. If TRUE, adds a second panel with coefficients and standardized effect sizes (default: FALSE).

facet.pers

Logical. If TRUE personalized contrasts are seen one by one (default: FALSE).

Value

A ggplot2 plot object or a combined plot (with patchwork) if coef = TRUE.

Details

The plot shows means, confidence intervals, significance of contrasts, and optionally overlays raw data points. It also display standardized coefficients and effect sizes.

Supported contrast types and their interpretations:

  • Treatment: Each group is compared to a baseline (first level).

  • Sum: Contrasts compare each group to the grand mean.

  • Successive differences (sdif): Each group is compared to the previous one.

  • Helmert: Each group is compared to the mean of all previous groups.

  • Reverse Helmert: Each group is compared to the mean of all subsequent groups.

  • Polynomial: Contrasts test polynomial trends across ordered factor levels.

  • Customized: User-defined contrasts.

Error bars represent 95% confidence intervals. Significant contrasts are highlighted according to the chosen significance level. The coefficient panel (if enabled) shows coefficient estimates with confidence intervals and standardized effect sizes.

Examples

if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{
  data(iris)
  iris$Species <- factor(iris$Species)
  model <- lm(Sepal.Length ~ Species, data = iris)
  MoPlotOneWay(model, data = TRUE, coef = TRUE)
} # }
